text: "Travelling Riverside Blues" is song by blues singer Robert Johnson. It was recorded in 1937 during his last session and went unreleased until its inclusion on his 1961 album King of the Delta Blues Singers. ==Led Zeppelin version== In 1969, Led Zeppelin recorded "Travelling Riverside Blues" for the BBC studios session at Aeolian Hall during their 1969 UK tour. It went to number 7 on the Billboard Top Rock charts and made #57 in Canada. ==References== Category:1961 songs Category:Blues music Category:Blues rock songs Category:Robert Johnson (musician) songs Category:Led Zeppelin songs
title: Travelling Riverside Blues
